description: lyo- +‎ -phile, c. 1900, US, perhaps from French lyophile (“lyophilic”).

adjectives.description: lyophile (comparative more lyophile, superlative most lyophile)

examples: As a class, the soil colloids seem to be related more nearly to the lyophobe than to the lyophile colloids, although materials isolated from some soils approach lyophile colloids in their ability to swell.
